item.title: KKR 为 Perpetual Buy 筹集 5 亿澳元私人信用贷款
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士透露，KKR & Co. 同意从 Blackstone Inc.【原文：KKR & Co. agreed to a private credit loan of about A$500 million ($331 million) from Blackstone Inc. and Goldman Sachs Asset Management to help finance its acquisition of Australia’s Perpetual Ltd.’s corporate trust unit, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 潮湿天气抑制零售业发展，英国四月经济停滞不前
item.description: 英国的经济复苏在大选前停滞不前，这对以经济正在好转为竞选筹码的首相苏纳克来说是一个挫折。【原文：Britain’s economic recovery ground to a halt in the run-up to the general election, a setback for Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, who has campaigned on evidence the economy is turning the corner.】

item.title: 中国出口通缩，但美国并未因关系减弱而受益
item.description: 当美国及其盟国谴责中国的工业 "产能过剩 "并准备提高关税作为回应时，那些与中国这个世界工厂建立联系的国家正在努力抑制通货膨胀。【原文：While the US and allies decry China’s industrial “overcapacity” and prepare to sharpen tariffs in response, those embracing links with the factory to the world are getting a hand in their efforts to tame inflation.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国 4 月 GDP 持平，好于经济学家预期
法国关系可能经不起这样的考验
item.description:
如果马克龙担心法国财政面临风险，那么他选择了一个英国脱欧级别的糟糕时机来举行临时大选。【原文：

If Macron is worried about the risk to French finances, he picked a Brexit-level poor time to call a snap election.

item.title: 卡扎克告诉 LTV：欧洲央行应逐步降低利率
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马丁斯-卡扎克认为，欧洲中央银行只应逐步降低借贷成本，以确保通胀不会卷土重来。【原文：The European Central Bank should only reduce borrowing costs gradually to ensure that there’s no resurgence in inflation, according to Governing Council member Martins Kazaks.】

item.title: 如果卢比波动，亚洲顶级货币交易风险将绊倒市场
item.description: 据分析师称，亚洲最赚钱的货币交易之一有可能成为其自身成功的牺牲品，如果市场突然转向，投资者就会一叶障目。【原文：One of Asia’s most lucrative currency trades risks becoming a victim of its own success, according to analysts, with investors blindsided if the market suddenly turns.】

item.title: 必和必拓与智利铜矿达成初步工资协议
item.description: 必和必拓集团（BHP Group）与智利工会领导人达成了初步工资协议，这标志着该公司将避免在一个铜矿举行代价高昂的罢工，该铜矿的配线金属供应量约占全球供应量的 1%。【原文：BHP Group reached a preliminary wage agreement with union leaders in Chile, signaling the company will avert a costly strike at a copper mine that accounts for about 1% of global supply of the wiring metal.】

item.title: 欧洲加快振兴资产支持证券市场的计划
item.description: 欧洲正在加大力度降低银行融资成本，并将风险转嫁给资本市场，以此腾出数十亿资金用于国防和绿色转型。【原文：Europe is intensifying efforts to make it cheaper for banks to raise funding and offload risk to capital markets as a way to free up billions for defense and the green transition.】

item.title: 西澳大利亚解决威胁采矿许可证的矿业纷争
item.description: 西澳大利亚州是铁矿石的主要生产地，该州政府已批准了一项立法草案，将确保该州采矿执照和许可证的安全。【原文：Western Australia’s government has approved draft legislation that will ensure the security of mining licenses and permits in the state, a major producer of iron ore.】

item.title: 顶级银行家称，劳动力税上调将促使客户离岸
item.description: Bidhi Bhoma 是由 Liberum 和 Panmure Gordon 合并而成的投资银行 Panmure Liberum 的副首席执行官。该公司的客户包括 200 多家上市公司，宣布合并时在英国和北美拥有约 280 名员工。【原文：Bidhi Bhoma is deputy chief executive officer of Panmure Liberum, the investment bank created by the merger of Liberum and Panmure Gordon. The firm counts more than 200 listed companies as clients, and employed about 280 people across the UK and North America when it announced the deal.】

item.title: 世界银行称生活费用飙升将抑制缅甸经济增长
item.description: 世界银行周三在一份新报告中称，由于食品和燃料成本高企、当地货币疲软以及缺乏美元，缅甸本财年的经济增长可能会持续疲软。【原文：Myanmar’s growth is likely to stay weak in the current fiscal year as high food and fuel costs, a weakening local currency and a lack of dollars drag on the economy, the World Bank said in a new report on Wednesday.】

item.title: 柔佛种植园、古林公司着眼于 22 年以来马来西亚最大的首次公开募股
item.description: 马来西亚棕榈油生产商柔佛种植园集团有限公司（Johor Plantations Group Bhd）和一名股东预计将在首次公开募股中筹集约 7.35 亿林吉特（约合 1.56 亿美元）的资金，这将使该集团有望在两年多的时间里完成该国最大规模的上市。【原文：Malaysian palm oil producer Johor Plantations Group Bhd and a shareholder expect to raise about ringgit 735 million ringgit ($156 million) in an initial public offering, putting the group on track to execute the country’s biggest listing in over two years.】

item.title: 全球资金开始蹑手蹑脚地重返印度股市
item.description: 随着有迹象表明印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）即使在新的联合政府中也将继续推行改革，外资开始削减对印度股市的减持评级。【原文：Foreigners have started trimming their underweight stance on Indian stocks as signs emerge that Prime Minister Narendra Modi will continue to pursue reforms even with the new coalition government.】

item.title: 印度市场热点：现金不断涌入
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您提供可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件的每日摘要。【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a daily digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets.】

item.title: 中国对粮食的胃口减小，世界市场面临危险
item.description: 中国对海外小麦和玉米的需求正在迅速减少，这可能会对世界谷物市场造成压力，因为世界第一大农产品进口国对谷物的强劲需求已经习以为常。【原文：China’s appetite for overseas wheat and corn is dwindling rapidly, which is likely to heap pressure on world grain markets that have grown accustomed to robust demand from the world’s top agricultural importer.】

item.title: 香港法官裁定 Segantii 案将移交地方法院审理
item.description: Segantii 资本管理公司的内幕交易案将移交地方法院，该法院可判处长达七年的更长刑期。【原文：Segantii Capital Management’s insider trading case will move to a District Court that can hand out longer prison sentences of as many as seven years.】

item.title: 汇丰增持中国基金合资公司股份，成为主要股东
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）同意收购其合作伙伴在一家中国基金合资企业中的部分股份，成为该公司的大股东，并进一步扩大其在世界第二大经济体的业务。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc agreed to buy part of its partner’s stake in a China fund venture, becoming a majority shareholder and adding to its expansion in the world’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利计划为澳大利亚富豪客户提供人工智能工具
item.description: 摩根士丹利计划在澳大利亚使用人工智能功能管理富人的投资组合，这家华尔街银行将在澳大利亚推出更多在世界其他地区使用的软件。【原文：Morgan Stanley plans to use artificial intelligence capabilities to manage rich people’s portfolios in Australia as the Wall Street bank roll outs more software in the country that’s used in other parts of the world.】

item.title: 激进对冲基金因向研究人员秘密付款而受罚
item.description: 美国对激进做空者的全面调查已产生了第一个显著的惩罚结果，同时也让人们罕见地看到了看跌研究人员与对冲基金之间有争议的合作，这些基金对公司下了很大的赌注。【原文：A sweeping US probe of activist short sellers has yielded its first notable punishment, while offering a rare glimpse into controversial collaborations between bearish researchers and hedge funds that place big bets against companies.】

item.title: 日本国债成为亚洲最差债券，日本央行债务拖累难堪重负
item.description: 日本政府债券已成为亚太地区表现最差的主权债务，原因是人们担心日本央行的货币政策举措的可预测性低于其他国家。【原文：Japanese government bonds have become the worst-performing sovereign debt in Asia-Pacific due to concern that the Bank of Japan’s monetary policy moves have become less predictable than its peers.】

item.title: 美联储将韩元的底线重新牢牢掐住
item.description: 在美联储做出政策决定之前，韩元可能会在 1 美元兑 1400 韩元左右的水平线上划线，因为韩元再次接近这一关键水平。【原文：South Korea is likely to draw a line in the sand for the won at around 1,400 per dollar, as the currency approaches that key level again ahead of the Federal Reserve’s policy decision.】

item.title: 中国考虑禁止银行代销对冲基金产品
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国监管机构正在考虑对银行向公众销售金融产品的方式实施更严格的限制，此举可能会切断中国一些最大对冲基金的主要销售渠道。【原文：Chinese regulators are considering tougher restrictions on how banks sell financial products to the public, in a move that could cut off a major distribution channel for some of the nation’s largest hedge funds, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织预计中国将重新安排阿根廷数十亿美元的债务
item.description: 国际货币基金组织预计，中国将重新安排其向阿根廷提供的 180 亿美元掉期额度的部分付款，这是在哈维尔-米莱伊总统大幅削减预算的情况下释放现金的关键一步，有助于维持该基金组织对阿根廷的大规模财政支持计划。【原文：The International Monetary Fund expects China to reschedule payments on part of the $18 billion swap line that it has extended to Argentina, a key step that frees up cash amid President Javier Milei’s deep budget cuts and helps sustain the fund’s massive fiscal support program for the country.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利银行家称澳大利亚是应对中国困境的避风港
item.description: 摩根士丹利澳大利亚主管理查德-瓦格纳（Richard Wagner）表示，澳大利亚正受益于资本流动的增加，这巩固了其在全球动荡时期缓冲投资风险的能力。【原文：Morgan Stanley’s Australia chief Richard Wagner said the country is benefiting from an increase in capital flows that cements its ability to cushion investment risk during a period of global turbulence.】

item.title: 穆迪称孟加拉国塔卡将因汇率下跌而再创新低
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）称，随着孟加拉中央银行放松对货币的控制，孟加拉塔卡有可能进一步跌至历史最低点。【原文：Bangladesh’s taka is likely to fall deeper into a record-low territory as the central bank loosens its grip on the currency, according to Moody’s Ratings.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。美国考虑对中国芯片准入实施更多限制。交易员在等待美国通胀和美联储利率决议。Pimco预计将有更多地区性银行倒闭。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. The US considers more restrictions on China’s chip access. Traders await US inflation and Fed rate decision. Pimco expects more regional bank failures. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 行业报告指出美国库存减少后石油上涨
item.description: 在国际能源署（IEA）发布市场前景报告之前，行业数据显示美国原油库存缩减，石油延续涨势。【原文：Oil extended gains after industry data pointed to shrinking US crude stockpiles ahead of a report from the IEA on the market outlook.】

item.title: 投资者担心辛鲍姆赢面过大，比索遭重挫
item.description: 墨西哥当选总统本应继承世界上表现最好的货币。然而，她面对的却是比索历史性的暴跌，这给她上任初期的领导工作蒙上了一层阴影。【原文：Mexico’s president-elect was set to inherit the world’s top performing currency. Instead she’s confronting a historic slump in the peso that’s casting a pall over her early days in leadership.】
